facts: The first computer mouse was invented in 1964 by Douglas Engelbart.
The term 'debugging' comes from Admiral Grace Hopper, who found a moth in a computer in 1947.
The first email was sent in 1971 by Ray Tomlinson.
Python was created by Guido van Rossum and first released in 1991.
The World Wide Web was invented by Tim Berners-Lee in 1989.
Bitcoin, the first cryptocurrency, was created in 2009 by Satoshi Nakamoto.
The first smartphone was the IBM Simon Personal Communicator, released in 1994.
JavaScript was created by Brendan Eich in just 10 days in 1995.
The first programming language was Ada Lovelace's work on the Analytical Engine in the 1840s.
Linux was created by Linus Torvalds in 1991.
